review_title: Overall great place to work and be!
pros: The pay and benefits are hard to beat at a local level. They're solid for the cost of living and hard to find elsewhere. Overall the staff, including leadership, is wonderful! It's a family environment and with the exception of one "leader," whom was investigated and dealt with appropriately, I've always felt I can discuss concerns with whoever I need to. PTO, PSL (including separate paid covid related leave now), paid holidays, weekends off, tuition reimbursement, 401 AND 451 both with employer match, and minimal expense to the employee for great medical benefits. I see other reviews that complain about the fun nature of the office: work hard, play hard. Nobody is forced into participating in any event if they don't want to.
cons: It can be difficult to move up in some departments. There are higher ups that will hold you back, even though they tell you how great you are. It can be extremely confusing. They're few and far between, but they do exist (just like any company, you always have a few bad eggs). Occasional favoritism - watching some staff be allowed to do one thing, while other staff isn't.

review_title: Salary is low for those w/ higher educational backgrounds
pros: Benefits were good. Promotes work life balance with additional time off and health incentive program. Promotes org culture also
cons: Salary for those with educational levels above an associate degree is low in comparison to other companies

pros: Good office culture & leadership
cons: Occasional but obvious favoritism, and excessive COVID policies.

pros: Great Pay, great benefits, flexibility,

pros: Work, work, work, work, work

review_title: Great place to work! Super supportive!

pros:
Working for a company that has a mission that is all about helping our communities be healthy, and a vision of being the most revered Health Plan, is awesome. This organization is empowering growth from the top to the entry level positions. 
The benefits are incredible. Retirement matching up to 6%, tuition reimbursement up 4000 per year for continued education, health insurance benefits with a very low employee contribution rate, and so much more!
The leadership that PHC has from the  CEO, COO, CFO, and our Northern Region Executive Director is unlike any company I have ever worked for before. I am heard, validated, supported and encouraged. These are executive leaders that are transparent and cheering you on every day. They are approachable and available. Previous companies I have worked for you never saw these people at that level, here we see them and talk to them often.
cons: I would say that sometimes if employment at PHC didn't work out for an employee that they tend to share that with other people still working at PHC. Sometimes, that can spread into current employees feeling uncertain about something however I think we all know that if someone leaves a company they have the ability to say whatever they want to say.

pros: The benefits are pretty good. There is some flexibility in scheduling.
cons:
There are many events that cost money to participate in, such as decorating for holidays, that are said to be voluntary, but extremely frowned upon if you don't participate. Not to mention that people collect for birthdays, and a company this big means that you are constantly expected to give money for someone's gift. This is also looked down upon if you don't participate. That attitude combined with the fact that we are working in an area that is getting more and more expensive, but not with the most pay, means that we are expected to shell out money for every little event, and have barely enough to cover living here. Our yearly raises for merit include the raise that is said to help fight inflation. 
So it makes it seem like you might be able to get a 5% raise, but when you account for the fact that much of that is to fight inflation, you are really only getting maybe 1% for merit each year. This is extremely disheartening, when we are living in an area where more and more bay area employees are moving to, thus causing huge increases in rent, and making it harder and harder to ever be able to buy a home.

pros:
-Great people
-Positive working environment
-Strong leadership
cons: I do not have any cons

pros: Even though the few reviews that are left here are negative, I have nothing but positive things to say about PHC.  I have been here for several years now and have enjoyed everything that I've done here.  Even though the company has grown tremendously over the past few years (thank you, Obamacare), we do our best to keep the family culture that exists here.  Work hard, and you'll be recognized for it.  And even if you aren't recognized for it, is that what you're here for?  The pay is reasonable, my co-workers are friendly, the location is great, the gym is nice, management is focused, more and more training is being offered, and we are doing our best to accomplish our mission:  to help members and communities we serve be healthy.  I know I won't be working here forever, but when it comes time for me to go, I will surely miss this place and the people here.
cons: Parking.  The company has expanded so quickly that there's hardly any space left if you arrive later in the morning.  Maybe remove some of the visitor parking?

pros: Good benefits, close for people who live in Solano County
cons:
The organization had rapidly changed from a small <100 employee organization to >500 employee organization in the space of 3 years. (They acquired the right to provide medicaid to counties in the far north of California and the territory trebled in size.) Many of the long-timers had grown up in Solano County and known each other since childhood. They had a really hard time adjusting to the influx of newcomers with different ideas, working with remote the office/ staff in Redding and just the increase in scale and planning necessary for serving 3x members. 

There were lots of cliques, queen bees, bullying and weird brown-nosing behavior that HR allowed to continue. They are also fond of many events that are typical of a high school, rather than a professional organization. Some examples include really elaborate desk decorations for birthdays (which your co-workers do in their spare time, not on the clock), a way over-the-top haunted house for Halloween (again, you do that after work during what should be leisure/ family time) and candygrams for valentine's day.

pros:
I've been with Partnership HealthPlan of California for about a year and a half now. I previously worked for a large, well-known insurance company. Partnership is by far the best employer I've ever had. They treat their employees like family. Not only are the benefits and pay the around, but we get to do so many fun things. Here are a few:
*Massages at work
*Employee bowling (everyone leaves work for 2 hours and bowls on company time)
*Amazing Christmas parties
*Employee Appreciation Luncheon (another fun off-site event)
*Tuition assistance

We're like a family here! And they treat us as such. They promote advancement. The health benefits are great and very reasonably priced. All the employees here are so happy and it shows!
cons: No cons (seriously!!) But Glassdoor is making me add a con....so, if I had to dig for a one it would be that our Redding, CA location is split into two separate buildings, instead of being together.

review_title: Great benefits, flexible schedule, poor management
job_title: Project Manager II in Fairfield, CA
pros: PHC has some of the best benefits you will find, although the pay is not as competitive as bay area, great PTO and healthcare benefits, with retirement matching. A lot of room to grow within the company if you work hard.
cons: Some departments (not speaking for all), and specifically some teams within the departments (not even the entire department itself), have an extremely terrible management flow. Complete lack of communication and consistency with expectations. Not all teams/departments does this apply to though, only my current experience.

pros: Standard benefit package. No weekends
cons: To many to list. I just wish I would have taken heed of the negative reviews and applied elsewhere. I am surprised that there isn't already a class action law suit against this company. Ethics are not at the top of their list and the employees are treated badly.  I am very concerned about the 'positive' reviews. They seem fake and were probably written by an employee in the Communications department. Hmmmmm.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Redding, CA
pros: I do not have an opinion.
cons: Read the statement I made.  It speaks to the company values.

pros: Strong Leadership from the CEO down, accountability, competitive wages, great benefits, rewarding work, and room for growth. Annual employee surveys are anonymously filled out and taken by leadership very seriously. Improvement groups are formed to address any issues that may be prominent in the survey.  Expectations are made clear on how to succeed at this company.
cons: Past employees may say that leadership is bias or unfair but the truth is  that employees are held accountable. PHC serves a large demographic and many members depend on the services PHC provides. It is for this reason that employees are held to such a high standard. Some people may interpret this accountability as a con but it makes the company stronger as a whole.

review_title: A decent healthcare company to work for
pros:
A decent healthcare company to work for

This company has a close knit family feel to it. The company has been growing at a rapid pace in the last 5-6 years but the top management is trying hard to keep the family feel intact. My Coworkers are pretty good and helpful. As with any other company, the experience could vary greatly based on the department and team you work for. 

Job stability, Work life balance, retirement and health benefits, 9/80 schedule, PTO policy, Annual salary reviews are the best things about this company.
cons:
The salaries are not comparable (not even close) to what a typical engineer gets paid in Bay Area. 

There is no Annual bonus or RSUs/Stocks/ESPP as this is a non profit healthplan.

I can't speak for other departments but IT Department is undergoing some organization structure changes that are long due. I really hope these changes will help the department and the company in the long run.

review_title: Beware Applying- Confidentiality with current employer not guaranteed
pros: Benefits structure, low level of responsibility, and limited patient contact. Growth is imminent due to growth in entitlement society for which it serves.
cons: If you apply, persons in charge of hiring process have no idea about importance of confidentiality. Two technicians took it upon themselves to call personal friends of theirs to ask about me as an applicant. In just a matter of days it was common knowledge within my current company that I was looking for other work. This may be fine if you are at a large chain, but for those of us at tighter knit companies, there are negative consequences. Thanks, Partnership!

review_title: The entire process was a long arduous disappointment.
pros:
Frontline staff were kind and hardworking
Benefits were optimal
Coffee machines and gym on site
Appeared to be a great move until there was no training or orientation and I didn't see my director but maybe twice the first two weeks.
cons:
Little to no orientation or training given
No communication from management 
No defined expectations were given
Favoritism was prominent among upper management 
Management has no concept of leadership, most used an outdated fear based style
Frontline staff taken advantage of and not paid appropriately while management wages continue to increase

job_title: Member Service Representative II in Fairfield, CA
pros: This department has a strong team. Their management is always very supportive of their employees. They do have typical call center statistics to be made. However, with the rigorous training that is provided, there is no reason why those stats can't be met by the time the training is done. They love to incorporate positive work life balance practices and have fun together when possible.
cons: The company itself overall is nice, good benefits, nice people. However, the company seems to be less focused on their employees the past few years. HR doesn't really listen to the employees concerns either.

pros: Amazing benefits and compensation! Lots of employee engagement activities and internal growth opportunities. It is enlightening to work for a company that truly supports and cares about the employees and the community we serve.
cons: There is nothing at this time that I can report that would keep me up at nights. There is always room for opportunity and the management team take staff input and suggestions seriously.

pros: The company and its morals are outstanding. The staff is friendly, and they encourage a open door policy which makes the work place that much better. This is the best company I have ever worked for and I am very proud to say I am apart of the team here.
cons: I have no cons for this work place. The entire staff always help if you have questions or concerns. They are very dedicated to their employees and their happiness.

review_title: Health Plan is great place to work
pros: Leadership keeps you updated on the strategic planning.  Updated on policies. Great benefits.  Competitive pay. Company sponsored wellness program. Opportunity for growth. Training and development team.
cons: A few employees can act like it's high school.  Just mind your own business and work.

pros: Listen to ideas for improvement, respect constructive criticism, make you feel like a valued employee. Great care takers of their members and financial responsibilities. Growth in the company and personal growth through education is encouraged.
cons: People are people. There are always interpersonal issues and office politics that can tarnish an otherwise stellar place to work.

review_title: Awful, awful awful company! The people, the work, the location - all just awful.
pros:
To support the “healthy” lifestyle:

- There is an on-site gym. Great!
- Management decided to spend a ton of money to build a cement walking path behind the building. Upper management thought this was the greatest thing since sliced bread. You tell me how walking along side an 10  lane highway, in 110 degree heat, filled with cars going 75 mph is good for you.  ??? This is a prime example of the poor thinking and bad decisions that drive everything at PHC:

So I guess the on-site gym would be the only Pro.
cons:
Important notes: 
1. There is NO TRAINING offered at this company. At all! (Though I did see a presentation about email etiquette that looked like a 6th grader had created. The gist of it: 'don’t use all caps.’) 
2. See RED FLAG below

Staff:
- Unskilled staff (Administrative Assistants don't even know how to use Outlook!)
- Procurement Bullies! Get on the good side of Procurement or be bullied. It will happen non-stop and you’ll end up buying your own supplies rather than having to deal with it. 
- A clueless, unskilled and elitist HR department that acts in the best interest of someone (not sure who) but it’s not in the best interest of the company! (see RED FLAG below)

Location:
Fairfield is, literally, the pit of the state. When I asked why the company is based there, a C-Suite exec told me: “They got an insanely cheap deal on the building.”

Interview:
During the interview, when they tell you "it's the people here that make it special" - ask, no, DEMAND them to define their use of the word "special."


RED FLAG: HR seems to come from a Christian-centric point of view. If you have to deal with Facilities/HR/Benefits, get ready for discussions that will include how ‘Jesus helps me deal with so-and-so and when I ask the Lord for assistance with... ' (This can’t be legal!)

review_title: Steer Away From the Northern Regional Office
pros:
They over pay nurses in an effort to overcome their hiring and retention problems which are most likely  due to poor  Executive leadership that encourages unethical behavior and fosters a hostile work environment in the Shasta county area office.

They have a lot of parties and events during work time.
cons:
The Executive Director in the Northern Region has many family and friends working in the various departments and it is a well known fact that the leadership is bullied by her and will do whatever she wants at the expense of the regular employee. 

The staff in all levels  fear her and will do whatever it takes to keep their job even if they have to lie. They have an employee satisfaction survey which is falsified in order to keep her attention off certain departments because if they were truthful she would force them into extra “goal” meetings where the regular staff have to participate and get their work done or they could be reprimanded for not being a team player.  She is a strong manipulator and I had seen quite a few good employees leave because she didn’t like them and made them look bad to her peers. This practice  is well known to the larger organization which seems to turn a blind eye so I doubt anything will change.

job_title: PICS I RN in Redding, CA
pros: PHC fosters a culture of inclusiveness , and encourages its employees to be the best versions of themselves. They offer tuition reimbursement and have regular "town halls" to hear first hand from the CEO where we astand as a company as well as where we are headed.
cons: The culture between the Northern and Southern Regions tend to differ slightly causing some difficulty in communication at times.

pros: Family friendly. Week day hours. Fun activities. On site gym. Working on going green. Friendly staff. Secure job
cons: Challenging cases. Exposure to tragic experiences with mental illness, drug addiction and poverty
